body: Hey @Potato1214, it is just that your testscript is ahead of your installation; if you grab the latest version from `master`, you'll have no problem ðŸ˜Š

Here is how to grab the latest code, btw! 

https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/wiki/How-to-use-the-latest-GitHub-code
I cloned the most recent code but this got this exact same error (TypeError: analyze_videos() got an unexpected keyword argument 'allow_growth'). Are there any other solutions you can think of?

> > I cloned the most recent code but this got this exact same error (TypeError: analyze_videos() got an unexpected keyword argument 'allow_growth'). Are there any other solutions you can think of? > > OS: MacOS (Mojave) DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.10.4 Anaconda env used: Yes Describe the problem TypeError: analyze_videos() got an unexpected keyword argument 'allow_growth' I followed the tutorial video step-by-step. How to Reproduce the problem Steps to reproduce the behavior: open Anaconda Prompt Activate DLC-CPU run python testscript.py

Something's wrong with your installation. If you follow the tutorial or install DLC via our conda environment files, the version should be 2.2rc1, not 2.1.10.4. Since you've already cloned the repo apparently, you could try the following:
```
conda activate DLC-CPU
cd DeepLabCut
pip install .
```
and it should work fine.
Indeed, please follow the instructions here, and when you check the version it should be 2.2rc1 as Jessy points out: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/wiki/How-to-use-the-latest-GitHub-code

> Indeed, please follow the instructions here, and when you check the version it should be 2.2rc1 as Jessy points out: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/wiki/How-to-use-the-latest-GitHub-code Thank you for your response! I have followed the steps and it is now showing this error instead. What should I do?
Interesting... I had the same problems as you and I am now stuck with this as well.  Any ideas on how to fix?  Thanks!

issue.title: Installing DeepLabCut on Windows 10, can't run testscript.py

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.2rc1
Anaconda env used: DLC-CPU

Hi, I'm using deeplabcut as part of a student project.

I have been trying to install deeplabcut on windows 10 (nvidia geforce RTX 2080) using either gpu or cpu, but I have been having issues trying to run the testscript.py file.
Initially, when I set up my conda environment using the DLC-CPU.yaml file, I tried running the testscript.py and had the known error found here: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1106 . 
It was resolved by following the conda install -c conda-forge ffmpeg advice. 
Then I got a new error similar to this one: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1265 . And so now I am stuck trying to upgrade the deeplabcut version from â€˜2.1.10.4â€™ to â€˜2.2rc1â€™. 
After upgrading to 2.2rc1 using pip install and trying to import deeplabcut, then I get what is shown in the screenshot below.
I've also tried running ./reinstall.sh file, but it didn't work for windows so I've also tried directly running the following:
pip uninstall deeplabcut 
python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
pip install C:\Users\LabMi\Documents\GitHub\DeepLabCut\dist\deeplabcut-2.2rc1-py3-none-any.whl 
However, I get the same error with import deeplabcut

What can I do?
Iâ€™ve tried upgrading different ways, but I always get the same error.
Has someone been able to install deeplabcut on windows 10 and can show their steps for an updated clean walk through, with or without gpu?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71452451/120266584-3e2a0900-c270-11eb-85b9-dc6b9ea9ef84.png)

Thank you so much for any help.

body:
I had the same issue but I could fix it.

I freshly installed DLC-GPU. The DLC version was 2.1.10.4. The testscript.py was giving the error `TypeError: analyze_videos() got an unexpected keyword argument 'allow_growth'`

Then I ran:
```
conda activate DLC-CPU
cd DeepLabCut
pip install .
```
which provided DLC version 2.2rc2.

At this point, the testscript.py completed successfully.

Hi! I am a widnows os user trying to use the DLC-GPU and faced a similar problem where the DLC version was 2.1.10.4 and running the testcscript.py gave the TypeError: analyze_videos() got an unexpected keyword argument 'allow_growth'.
The problem is when i updated the DLC to the 2.2rc1 and try to run the testscript again, i face the "error [WinError 126] The specified module could not be found".
Could someone guide me how to solve this? Thank you!
Hi @suhjinlee! What is the module that could not be found? Can you post the full error?

@jeylau Here is the full error! Thank you!
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43252216/121214060-c1bfa780-c8b9-11eb-98a9-8aa3df7253e1.png)

To give more details. 
I created a environment using conda create -n DLC python=3.7 tensorflow=1.13.1
with cuda 10. cudnn 7.4.2
and then installed deeplabcut by pip install deeplabcut and adding pip install -U wxPython<4.1.0

Another user reported the same error https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1292. Try `pip install shapely` and that should work; otherwise, create your conda environment from the configuration files we provide in DeepLabCut/conda-environments, this is safer. ðŸ˜ƒ

@jeylau  Thanks for the quick response. the install shapely method didn't work so i created a new environment with the DLC-GPU.yaml file. With this route, I can import deeplabcut initally without error in ipython. however, when I try to run the testscript.py, it still gives me this error.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43252216/121313778-b1eba600-c941-11eb-85f4-4f703de6b457.png)

I tried to download the python.app referring to this post https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1218#issuecomment-853280085
but get error of this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43252216/121314077-fa0ac880-c941-11eb-8805-8245ebc2d951.png)

it also seems sth related to this post https://forum.image.sc/t/no-module-named-deeplabcut-windowsgpu/29067 
because i cannot find deeplabcut in the conda list.....in the environment even though i am in the admin conda powershell and downloaded the deeplabcut with ./reinstall.sh

The `conda install python.app` fix is specific to MacOS, so that result is not surprising.

Deeplabcut does not show if your run `conda list` in your env? That means that something failed with the deeplabcut installation during the env creation, but assuming that the rest of env was properly created, I think you should be able to run `pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.2rc2` within your env. 

Also, instead of posting screen grabs of errors, it's much easier to read if you copy and paste the text, between two rows of three tilde marks. In other words

\`\`\`
paste error here
\`\`\`

@backyardbiomech Thank you. Now it does show on the conda list and can run the testscript.py. I have some other errors but will look online first to see how i can fix them.

And thank you for letting me know how to paste the error. i will do that moving on!
